Module com.example.battleship
Package com.example.battleship.model

Class BoardPlayer

java.lang.Object
com.example.battleship.model.BoardPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BoardPlayer extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the player's board in the Battleship game. Manages ship placement, shooting mechanics, and board state.
See Also:

    Constructor initializes the board grid with empty cells

  • Method Details

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int row, int col)
      Retrieves the cell at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      Returns:
      The Cell object at the specified coordinates.

    • isInside

      public boolean isInside(int row, int col)
      Check if the given coordinates are inside the board

    • canPlace

      public boolean canPlace(Ship ship, int row, int col, boolean horizontal)
      Checks if a ship can be placed at the specified coordinates and orientation.
      Parameters:
      ship - The ship to be placed.
      row - The starting row index.
      col - The starting column index.
      horizontal - True if the ship is to be placed horizontally, false for vertical.
      Returns:
      True if the ship can be placed, false otherwise.

    • placeShip

      public void placeShip(Ship ship, int row, int col, boolean horizontal) throws ShipPlacementException
      Places a ship on the board at the specified coordinates and orientation.
      Parameters:
      ship - The ship to be placed.
      row - The starting row index.
      col - The starting column index.
      horizontal - True if the ship is to be placed horizontally, false for vertical.
      Throws:
      ShipPlacementException - If the ship cannot be placed due to collisions or boundaries.

    • shoot

      public ShotResult shoot(int row, int col)
      Shoots at the specified cell on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the target cell.
      col - The column index of the target cell.
      Returns:
      The result of the shot (HIT, MISS, SUNK) or null if the cell was already shot.

    • allShipsSunk

      public boolean allShipsSunk()
      Checks if all ships on the board have been sunk.
      Returns:
      True if all ships are sunk, false otherwise.

    • relocateShipAfterRotation

      public void relocateShipAfterRotation(Ship ship, int row, int col, boolean horizontal)
      Relocates a ship after rotation to new coordinates and orientation.
      Parameters:
      ship - The ship to be relocated.
      row - The new starting row index.
      col - The new starting column index.
      horizontal - True if the ship is to be placed horizontally, false for vertical.

    • getPlacedShips

      public Deque<Ship> getPlacedShips()
      Getter for placed ships

    • placeShipsAutomatically

      public void placeShipsAutomatically(double cellSize) throws ShipPlacementException
      Automatically places ships on the board for an AI player.
      Parameters:
      cellSize - The size of each cell for ship dimensions.
      Throws:
      ShipPlacementException - If a ship cannot be placed after multiple attempts.
